newsitem.title: USA: Cook County CFO says $145 mln refunding not ready.
newsitem.headline: Cook County CFO says $145 mln refunding not ready.

text.p: Cook County Chief Financial Officer Thomas Glaser said Friday that market conditions have improved, but not yet reached a level favorable to pursue another refunding of general obligation debt.

Cook County commissioners gave officials the authority to refund up to $554 million of bonds in February 1996. They have made two refundings since and could refund up to $145 million under the authority granted, Glaser said.
Glaser said officials are "following the ticking down," but do not anticipate acting on it next week.
After the last refunding deal in May with lead manager Smith-Barney Inc, Glaser had anticipated acting on the remaining authority in the fall if market conditions were favorable.
